column3: This seems like it is merely working around a bug that should be fixed. Am I wrong?\n

Well I'm not sure and I'd defer to you, but my thought was that:

a) the getblocktemplate rpc call only successfully completes if IsInitialBlockDownload returns true,
b) IsInitialBlockDownload is generally going to return false on startup of a bitcoind running in regtest mode, because it will be checking the time on the best block, which will either be the genesis block or the tip of the cached
(b) precludes (c) when/if we replace setgenerate with an external test script. I think (b) needs to change? Timestamp-based logic here shouldn't be necessary now that we have headers first, right?\n
